title: Liverpool keen on Kostas Manolas transfer — but face competition from Arsenal and Manchester United
text:
Sport Liverpool keen on Kostas Manolas transfer — but face competition from Arsenal and Manchester United Roma defender who impressed one of Jurgen Klopp's top scouts in midweek was subject of £35m Gunners bid last summer Share Manolas is a name to watch as Klopp (inset) looks to revamp Liverpool's shaky back four (Photo: Getty) Share Get Liverpool FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Liverpool are hot on the trail of £35million-rated Roma centre-back Kostas Manolas. 
Boss Jurgen Klopp dispatched one of his top scouts to check on the commanding Greek defender in the Europa League against Lyon in the Italian capital on Thursday - and he was impressed. 
Manolas starred in a 2-1 win for Roma, although it was the French visitors who went through to the quarter-finals 5-4 on aggregate. 
The 25-year-old has attracted plenty of Premier League attention, with Arsenal reportedly having a £35m bid turned down last summer. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Klopp rates Man City toughest team to play ahead of Etihad visit Share this video Klopp insists he will not be satisfied with a point at Man City on Sunday 
It's believed it was rejected because there was still a 50 per cent sell-on clause in force guaranteeing the defender's former club, Athens-based Olympiacos, half of any fee Roma took for the highly-rated star. 
That clause has now expired, though, and Liverpool are in the race to sign the Greece international this summer. 
Quick and strong, Manolas has been a big hit at Roma and has two years left on his contract. Mourinho and Wenger also have Manolas on their shopping lists (Photo: Man Utd via Getty) 
But despite being one of their highly-valued stars, he is reportedly earning only around £25,000-a-week. 
Liverpool could treble that — but they face competition from the still-keen Gunners as well as Manchester United, who also have a long-standing interest in Manolas. Like us on Facebook
